interlinear-text.item: Recorded by Husniya Khujamyorova in Vnukt, Tajikistan, June, 2016.

phrase.item: There were two friends.
One of the friends had a good heart and the other had a bad heart.
When one of them finds anything like food, (or) when he buys clothes for himself --
that one with the good heart, he buys for his friend as well.
​ The one with the bad heart always runs away from him.
Even when he finds something like food or drink, he never shares.
He buys clothes for himself, but not for his friend.
Then the one with a good heart ends up hungry and naked.
He meets his friend with the bad heart and says,
"Hey, now at least also give me some food or clothing.
I have no energy to reach my destination."
But the other man laughs at him and doesn't give him anything.
He wasn't a real friend, he had a bad heart, a false one.
Then he says, "Well, okay!"
He approaches a wilderness.
He walks through the wilderness, worrying, and says,
"What should I do now, I might have to stay overnight in this wilderness!"
He keeps walking and sees a small structure. He goes there and sees a mill, there in the wilderness.
He enters and goes inside the "water room" [where the water for the mill was running].
He enters the water room inside the mill, he knows the look of it.
He comes out of there and says,
"There isn't anything that can come inside and eat me during the night."
Then he comes out of the mill, walks around and worries, the one with a good heart.
The kind friend with a happy heart.
Then he comes out of there, walks around, and enters the mill [again] saying,
"Oh, it is impossible to stay here, something will eat me."
He says, "When they put the wheat in the mill's belly, inside the mill, I will go inside, I hope nothing will see or find me."
He enters and a bear, a wolf and a fox come inside.
They come and the bear says,
"Hey, fox, can you go and check around the mill if there is any enemy around?"
Then [the fox] says-- he looks around and says "No, there is nothing."
[The bear] tells the fox, "Please go inside the water room and check if there is something or not.
Go inside the water room and check if we have any enemies there or not."
He goes inside the water room and says, "No, nothing!"
[The bear] says, "If so, that's great!"
Then they come out and leave from there.
Those three spend the night there and
in the morning the wolf, bear and the fox leave there.
[The man] is inside the belly (of the mill), they don't look there.
In the morning they get up and leave the place, [and the man] also gets up and leaves. He was in a very bad condition, hungry and naked.
He walks for a long time and approaches a wilderness, he gets very tired, he walks a lot.
I would say he walks for about 25 to 30 kilometers.
He feels very weak and sees a yurt and a herder with animals there.
He reaches there and (the herder) welcomes him very well and becomes happy, and says, "What type of person are you?"
He says, "I had a friend, a real friend, unfortunately, whatever I used to find, I would share with him.
I would even feed him, but he left me like this. He did not take care of me.
I stayed over night in such and such places."
[The herder] says, "Weren't you scared?"
[The man] replies,
"Well, I was very scared but I hid myself. I jumped into the the mill's belly. Now I am relying on you ["saying you"] and so I came."
[The herder] says, "I wish to meet people, and I am happy having you here."
I am the king's herder."
Now a black lamb is going to be born. If more (black lambs) come, they will be his (the king's) but if it is white, it will be mine."
Now it depends on your footstep (luck)."
Then so many lambs and kid goats were delivered.
He works with him for forty days there.
He helps the king's herder at delivering time.
Then they get so many lambs and baby goats that it's hard to imagine.
After that, he stays for a month or so, and the lambs all get bigger.
They all recognize their mothers (baby goats and lambs), and [the man with the good heart] says,
"Hey, now let me go!"
[The herder] says, "Oh, it is not possible to let you go without giving you some reward.
I will give you something."
Then [the man] goes to the city and says,
"Okey, I will go to the city, and then I will come back to visit you!"
So says the man to the king's herder.
[The herder] says, "Okay, go."
Then [the man] goes up and sees that the king's daughter had become ill.
The king's daughter had gotten sick and young men were coming to her saying,
"I will treat her." One says, "I will", and another one says, "I will".
Nobody was able to treat her. The king orders all the young men to be hanged.
They were all killed.
The minister says [to the good man],
"Hey, what kind of person are you? All these young men were killed by the king, are you also tired of your soul [of living]?
Tired of your soul = tired of living
"He will hang you as well."
[The good man] says, "Wait a minute, I will do something."
"I will check her and then I will decide what to do."
Then he says- [the minister] lets him go, [the man] goes and checks,
and he says, "King, let me me check your daugther and I will treat her."
He goes, checks her and says,
"Now give me permission, I will go and find all the medicne for her and no one else is needed."
Then he comes and realizes she has a lung (problem).
She has a lung (problem), the king's daughter.
Nobody knew the treatment for her.
Then [the man with the good heart] comes to the king's herder, the one whom he worked with before and tells him,
"Now you shouldn't give me anything.
Just give me your dog."
He had a type of dog that could bite a sparrow in the air, a black "four eyed" dog [with marks above the eyes].
The extra two eyes refer to the marks above the eyes that black dogs usually have.
[The dog] was a treatment for the king's daughter.
He slaughters the dog, buries the head and feet and all that, washes all the rest and then he grinds the meat using the big stone bowl (dʒwozg).
He chops all the bones and the brain and gives some from that to [the king's daughter].
The meat will be finished within forty days and he will tell the king, "Come and take your daughter."
She is as happy and pretty as she was before, the king's daughter.
So [the man] does all this and [the king's] daughter says,
"No, I am going to marry this young man now.
This is the one who healed me."
Her father says, "No!"
She says, "Why not?"
I am going to marry only this man and nobody else.
He healed me."
Then [the man] emerges with the king's daughter.
When he comes to the city, he meets his "brother", the one with bad heart and he says,
"Hey, what did you do that this beautiful lady became yours?"
He didn't know that she was the king's daughter.
He says, "Well, God didn't ignore a poor person's labor, my sorrow also was accepted in God's gate.

You didn't take care of me. You didn't give me bread. In that wilderness, you didn't give me clothes. Whatever I bought, I gave you, I fed you , I covered your body with clothes. You were unfair to me."
Now, I am going to tell you my story."
[The bad friend] says, "Okay, I am also going [to do things] the way you did.
"You went through hardship all this time, I will do the same, whatever you did. Maybe I will also receive something."
[The good friend] says, "Well, it is up to you, I cannot force you."
And he leaves.
He also goes and stays in the mill overnight and
he gets into the the water room, (but) his heart kept thumping.
He gets out of that place and walks around and says,
"Okay, I am going inside the belly the way he told me."
[Not clear]
"They say that the king's daughter's treatment is the herder's dog,"
Now going back in time to the friend with the good heart and how he discovered the remedy. He overheard the animals talking about it.
said the bear, wolf and the fox.
And he hears that,
the man with the good heart.
Otherwise he wouldn't have known it.
[The dog] catches the birds in the air, he doesn't let them live.
Then [the bad man] says, "Okay, let me go and I'll do the same."
[The animals] come, and the one with bad heart enters the mill and jump inside the belly. He could not even fit himself in there and the door opens.
The door opens and the bear says,
"Hey wolf, fox, go around this thing (mill) and check if there are any enemies around.
When we said that the last time, in fact we had an enemy here.
You didn't check properly, we made a mistake."
Then the wolf jumps into the water room and says to the fox,
"Can you check inside the belly if there is any enemy?"
[The fox] sees that the one with bad heart is there. They take him out and tear him to pieces.
Then they tear him apart and say,
"We didn't check last time.
We had an enemy. The king's [herder's] dog has also disappeared."
The king's [herder's] dog was the king's daughter's enemy.
[The dog] treated the king's daughter. The dog is no more.
He (the dog) used to take off birds' feathers in the air
He was the king's daughter's treatment.
Then that boy marries the king's daughter.
His father-in-law is the big king, the daughter is also a king.
Governing and winning falls to the daughter, (but) the king is this boy.
This boy with the good heart becomes a king in this city.
After her father, this girl takes on the role of governing and winning, (but) her husband is the king.
He also reaches his goal.
